title: Manchester City flying thanks to wings Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling.. and Pep Guardiola warns pair can still improve
text:
Sport Manchester City flying thanks to wings Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling.. and Pep Guardiola warns pair can still improve The young wide-men are clicking on the pitch, with a combined nine goals and six assists in the last 10 games, and off it too Share Guardiola hopes we ain't seen nothing yet from 22-year-old Sterling and Sane, 21 (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football     
Pep Guardiola has told Blues Brothers Raheem Sterling and Leroy Sane they must keep improving. 
Sterling and Sane have been key to Manchester City ’s revival as goal makers and takers and the Blues host Stoke City on Wednesday, on the back of a nine-game unbeaten run in all competitions. 
The pair have been tormenting opposition defences — over their last 10 games, Sterling has recorded three goals and five assists, while Sane's netted six times and created another. 
Guardiola is delighted with the form of his two widemen... but has also challenged them to keep improving. Summer-buy Sane got his sixth City goal on Sunday — all scored in the last three months (Photo: Getty) Read More Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus steps up recovery in pool following broken foot 
“Raz (Sterling) is playing a lot — a lot of minutes, a lot of games,” said the City boss. “It’s true how many chances he creates, how many chances he scores from. He creates penalties, he’s aggressive without the ball, presses and many other things. 
“It is the same case as Leroy. He’s a guy who still needs to improve. I would not like him to believe or think that it’s already done, that he’s good enough. 
“He can be better — especially in the simple things. Still he makes mistakes in the simple and easy things. When he improves that, wow! 
“You have to start with the simple things and then work on dribbling the ball, scoring goals, these kind of things. But he has the talent.” 
Sterling and Sane are similar in age and the England star encouraged the German during his difficult start to his City career before he netted his first goal against Arsenal in December. Sterling has helped Sane settle in England while starring with him on the pitch (Photo: Getty) Read More David Silva feels his Man City side have hit top form at just the right time 
Guardiola is grateful for the help Sterling and John Stones gave Sane as the 21-year-old adjusted to life in England following his £37million switch from Schalke. 
“People believed that he would settle within a few seconds,” said the Spaniard. “He needs time. From the moment he was involved, on and off the pitch, the English players, like Raz and John Stones, helped him a lot. 
“The quality was there in the beginning. He’s playing good, but also we’re showing him a lot of clips - how many not good things he is doing and what he can improve. You cannot expect at 20 or 21 everyone is done. He has a lot of time to be a better player - a lot.” 
Sane and Sterling have become a real double act in the dressing room too, even having the temerity to tease 34-year-old midfielder Yaya Toure by calling him "Uncle". The City pair have bonded over a love of similar music — and teasing Yaya Toure (Photo: Getty) Read More Leroy Sane "reminds me of Gareth Bale" says City team-mate Gael Clichy 
This 2017 version of the SAS enjoying chilling out together and like listening to the same kinds of music. 
Guardiola is pleased by their friendship because he feels this shows the team spirit in the dressing room is strong. 
“It’s nice,” he said. “Of course, we like it. 
“It’s nice when we go to Abu Dhabi and see how close they are. That’s a most precious and beautiful thing. The team spirit is better than ever since I’ve been here. That’s what I like the most.” poll loading Where will Manchester City finish this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
